data.name: Metolius
data.description:
This golden colored ale closely approximates a lager in its crisp, dry palate, low hop aroma, light body and light malt sweetness.  The finish is very clean with a lingering subtle fruitiness.  Metolius Golden is a well balanced, refreshing, food friendly beer that goes down easy on a warm afternoon.

2010 North American Brewers Association Awards Bronze medal winnner!

breweries.name: Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Bend Brewing Company overlooks the Deschutes River at Mirror Pond in Bend, Oregon. Locally owned and operated, this exceptional brewpub opened its doors in February of 1995 and quickly became a favorite for locals and visitors alike. The people of the B.B.C. take pride in creative, award-winning handcrafted brews, fresh and flavorful menu selections, a casual and friendly atmosphere and superb service.

Bend Brewing Co. is a great place to have lunch, dinner or just some hot nachos and cold handcrafted beer after a day skiing or hiking in Central Oregon's recreational paradise.  In the summer, B.B.C.'s patio is the best place in town to dine outside. In the winter, come in and warm up with a malty seasonal ale.   Come and see for yourself why we're the locals' favorite!

data.name: Mic Czech
data.description: Made with Pilsner malt and Saaz hops from the Czech Republic, our take on this classic European lager is light golden in color with a dense creamy white head. Lagered for seven weeks it has a nice clean malty backbone with an assertive dose of floral and spicy hop character. Czech it out and see why this style of beer single handedly changed the world of beer as we know it today

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

data.name: Mid-West Farmer's Daughter Ale
data.description: Our flagship beer and most popular, this light blonde ale delivers on its promise. It really makes you feel alright. It is smooth, easy drinking and refreshing but not too light. This brew has a subtle malt and hop character and a crisp clean finish, making it an easy drinking experience.

breweries.name: Choc Beer Company
breweries.description:
Meet Oklahoma's oldest handcrafted beer.

In Italian immigrant Pete Prichard's effort to support his family, he came up with the idea of using an Indian Territory recipe to brew a beverage for the coal miners.

Pete's idea led to trouble during Prohibition. He was convicted, not once but twice, for breaking the federal Prohibition Act.

Prohibition was repealed in the late 1950s, but home brewed beverages were still illegal because they didn't bear the proper liquor stamps. Nevertheless, homemade Choc and wine continued to be available to regular customers at Pete's, a restaurant owned by Prichard in Krebs, Okla.

Those customers happen to include JFK and high-powered Oklahoma politicians.

Finally, in 1995, through tireless efforts on the part of Joe Prichard, the grandson of the founder, Pete's Place reintroduced Choc beer as part of the restaurant's tradition and a "legal" brew for customers.

data.name: Minglewood American Blonde Ale
data.description: Made with American Malts, Yeast, and Hops, this brilliantly clear Blonde Ale has a malty backbone with a sweet and refreshing finish.  It’s a light sessionable beer brewed with the recent craft beer converts in mind.

breweries.name: Flying Dog Brewery
breweries.description:
The Flying Dog Legend begins in 1983, and like every good legend there are several versions of this tale. The villains of the peace in this story are two non-conformist, 'not likely to take it lying down' ranchers named George Stranahan and Richard McIntyre.

As George tells it, he and 11 of his closest friends and family decided to embark on what they called an “amateur mountaineering expedition” to climb K2 in the Himalayas. Under-qualified and unprepared, they started their journey with a Sherpa, a donkey, and a suitcase full of contraband. Naturally, half way through the trip the contraband was gone and the Sherpa and donkey had run off, leaving George and his group to fend for themselves. Luckily, everyone managed to make it off the mountain alive, and with a new outlook on life.

Horn Dog Denver Colorado BeerLike any good beer drinker would at the end of an experience like that, George and his group found a local Pakistani hotel bar to have a drink in. Now, alcohol is banned in most Muslim nations, but if you sign an affidavit stating you are the son of a Christian, it’s like a license to drink. George gladly signed away and got down to some serious drinking. That’s about the time he noticed a painting in the Flashman Hotel of a Flying Dog hanging on the wall that had been drawn by a local artist. Now, we all know dogs don’t fly, but nobody told this particular dog it couldn’t fly, just like no one had told George and his friends they couldn’t make this extraordinary journey. The Flying Dog became a symbol that George and his group used to describe what had happened to them with the mantra, “it is amazing what you can achieve if nobody tells you that you can't.

breweries.name: The Bruery
breweries.description:
A boutique craft brewery located in Orange County, California specializing in experimental and barrel aged beer. Our name is a fusion of 'brewery' with our family name, Rue.

Our calling is to create beers with character and depth using the simplest and purest of means. We do not filter or pasteurize our beers. Most of our bottled beers gain carbonation through bottle conditioning, allowing carbonation to naturally occur through a secondary bottle fermentation. We strive to use unconventional ingredients, and we will proudly state what we put in our beers.

data.name: Missionary Blonde Ale
data.description:
"I can remember when the air was clean and sex was dirty." -George Burns
Sometimes what we want is a relaxing drinking experience, easy in its method but elegant in its simplicity. Enter Missionary Blonde Ale. We use only one malt (Pilsner) and one hop (Saaz) to make this simple, yet classically-styled beer. The use of ale yeast lends a subtle fruity character to the otherwise crisp, light finish. But the thing we like best about Missionary: Drinking it is so easy, anyone can do it.

breweries.name: Funky Buddha Brewery
breweries.description:
Funky Buddha Brewery was founded in 2010 in Boca Raton, Florida, and is committed to producing bold craft beers that marry culinary-inspired ingredients with time-honored technique. Our mantra is big, bold flavors, made exactingly with natural ingredients. So, for example, if we say a beer will taste like peanut butter and jelly, you can be sure you’ll smell and taste the fresh roasted peanuts and fruity berry jam. Our flagship beers such as Hop Gun IPA and Floridian Hefeweizen, also strive towards big, bold flavor. It’s who we are.

Our Brewery is located in the heart of Oakland Park’s new Culinary Arts District. The 20,000 sq-ft facility is powered by a 30-barrel, three-piece brewhouse, which feeds nearly 1000 gallons of beer per batch into our four 60-barrel fermenters - a capacity that makes us South Florida’s largest craft microbrewery. Each of our distinctive beers is brewed using the finest, all-natural ingredients, then served up unpasteurized, unfiltered, and unfussed with. We offer tours of our 20,000 sq-ft facility, rotating food trucks nightly, and growlers of our brewery fresh beer to-go.

You can sample our creations in our spacious tap room - open 7 days a week, noon to midnight - as well as in bars and restaurants all across South Florida. And of course, we still brew at our original location in Boca Raton, the Funky Buddha Brewery & Lounge, which has become a test kitchen for our more experimental brews.

See you soon for a pint! Cheers!

breweries.name: Kilowatt Brewing
breweries.description:
Kilowatt Brewing produces unique styled, hand-crafted beer located in the Kearny Mesa neighborhood. Creative and interactive lighting permeates throughout the brewery and taproom featuring rotating artwork created by local artists. Custom programmed LED lighting allows us to change the lighting color and mood in real-time while our customers enjoy Kilowatt’s unique beer styles in a one-of-a-kind taproom.

Kilowatt rotates in outside chefs and gourmet food trucks providing different styles of food and menus daily, while allowing you to experience select culinary items paired with complimentary styles of beer. For example an Asian style food truck will pair unique menu items with Kilowatt’s Green Tea Ale, Coconut Chai Porter, or Goji Berry Mountain Honey Ale.

data.name: Moncony Wet Hop Harvest Ale
data.description: This fall brew is bursting with hop flavor from locally grown Moncony Farms, owned by our Lead Brewer, Zack Hill. Experience this liquid dream as it pours a hazy golden straw color with a luscious white head. Your first sip rewards you with a super juicy hop presence bursting with fresh citrus flavor provided by local Chinook and Centennial Hops. It’s followed by a smooth finish of toasted malt undertones provided by a base of NYS Pale, Pilsner, and Caramel Malts. This killer Harvest Ale is in a class of its own and is sure to make you yearn for Fall brew all year long.

breweries.name: The Lost Borough Brewing Co.
breweries.description: The Lost Borough Brewing Company is the realization of a dream for three life long friends Dave Finger, James Meyer and Dan Western in search of the perfect pint of craft beer brewed right here in the Rochester. After years of experimentation with all styles of artisan beers we have decided to leave our mark by opening a local brewery where we can share our passion with others and provide truly difference craft beer experience.

data.name: Mondo's Blonde Ale
data.description: Named after a local beginning surf beach just North of Ventura. Brewed in the style of an American Cream Ale, Mondo's is a refreshing lighter bodied ale, with a mild bready malt character and just a hint of corn to add a crisp finish and accent the subtle hop bitterness. Pairs well with salad or grilled chicken. Silver Medal winner at the 2012 LA County Fair Commercial Beer Competition.

data.name: Moon Boy Golden Ale
data.description:
Moon Boy is a very drinkable, session-strength, all natural Golden Ale.

Moon Boy has a very light Australian Pilsner malt backbone with a crisp, dry, very moreish finish. Extensive dry hopping with the New Zealand grown Nelson Sauvin, Motueka and Pacifica hop gives a late tropical fruit aroma to spice things up - but without too much residual hop bitterness. Light, dry, lightly filtered, Moon Boy is great warm weather drinking.

breweries.name: Murray's Craft Brewing Co
breweries.description:
At Murray’s we are fanatical about the quality of our beers. We use only the best quality ingredients sourced from Australia and around the world and we give all of our beers extended conditioning times – no rushing.

Established in late 2006 by passionate craft beer enthusiast, Murray Howe, Murray’s Craft Brewing Co. has quickly gained a reputation as one of Aust best Craft Brewers. So much so that we were awarded ‘Best Brewer in Australia’ in October 2012. 

Crafted in Port Stephens on the beach on the NSW Hunter region our hugely sought-after range of unconventional, unique and sometimes just plain weird – full-flavoured beers are available across Australia.

We’re not a corporation and we’d NEVER lower our standards to sell more beer. Rest-assured our beers have won more awards than our ads. Murray’s is proudly 100% Australian-owned.

Murray’s… Made of the Right Stuff.

breweries.name: Moon Under Water
breweries.description:
The Moon is a true “beer bar”, which means a selection of only the finest brews, paired with food designed for every taste and even serving the beers in new glassware appropriate to the style of beer. 

The new Moon beers can be described as ‘German-fusion’ and are Brewmaster Clay’s West-coast interpretation of traditional German styles. All beers are 100% natural, unfiltered and naturally carbonated. Guest beers are handpicked to showcase some of the best Craft Beers in British Columbia and served alongside the house brewed beers.

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

data.name: Morning Glow
data.description:
A morning awakens with the soft glow of golden perfection. Hazy rays of sunshine peek through the silence, bringing the first light to a new day. Scents of daybreak and sounds of a new beginning permeate the air.

Make your morning, evening, or afternoon glow our vanilla coffee blonde ale. We've gently infused a delicate blonde coffee, creating a palatable work of art, reminiscent of a vanilla latte paired with a freshly baked scone.

breweries.name: Swamp Head Brewery
breweries.description:
Founded in 2008, upon the foundation of our great state, we raised our roof to brew world-class beers and establish ourselves as Florida’s brewery. Having travelled through lands far and close, and finding inspiration along the way, we are proud to be here, proud to be Inherently Floridian.

It has been our mission since day one to be Florida's brewery. We love our neighbors, but we're focused on providing our state with the beer it deserves.

That's only a small part of it.

Have a look around, from our brewery, to our logo and branding, to our beer, you can see that we live, love and are Florida. From now until the horizon, Swamp Head Brewery is Inherently Floridian.

locations.name: Main Brewery

data.name: Mother Ale
data.description: Mother Ale pays homage to the best in all of us. This rich bodied golden ale is smooth and satisfying. Brewed using North American grown pilsner and wheat malts, and topped off with European noble hops, Mother Ale is a reminder that mother knows what’s best. After a day of fishing, rafting, or just marveling at the bounty of mother earth, no beer knows what “ales” you better.

breweries.name: Denali Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Denali Brewing Company is Talkeetna, Alaska's local craft brewery. In addition to serving the community of Talkeetna through our tasting room and sister establishment, Twister Creek Restaurant, our beers are on tap at an increasing number of killer bars and restaurants in and around the Mat-Su Valley and Anchorage, Alaska.

At Denali Brewing Company we use only the finest ingredients to handcraft the kinds of honest beers you like to drink.

breweries.name: Laurelwood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Hi, my name is Mike De Kalb, and I’m the co-owner of Laurelwood Public House & Brewery in Portland, Oregon. My wife Cathy and I started Laurelwood in 2001 because we wanted a place where family and friends could meet in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. My restaurants are non-smoking and family-friendly.

And the beer? World class. Brewing Portland’s first certified organic beers, and a host of other tasty brews. We’ve received a number of awards including Champion Brewery at the 2004 World Beer Cup. Led by Brewmaster Vasilios Gletsos, our brewers create all our beers using only the finest ingredients. Stop by one of our three public houses and or one of our two Portland airport locations for a pint and a meal.   Make sure when you are out and about that you ask for Laurelwood beer at your favorite Oregon or Washington pub.

breweries.name: Grist Iron Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Opening in the spring of 2015, Grist Iron Brewing Company will join a growing league of fine craft beer artisans along the shores of Seneca Lake, NY.  We are being deliberate with every detail that goes into the design of the brewery from the craft beers on tap to the music on the stereo so we can make sure that Grist Iron Brewing is a place you'll want to return. Food is important so along with a fantastic craft beer selection, made by brewer and co-owner Patrick Palmer, we will have two brick ovens serving as the foundation for our signature menu using as many fresh, local ingredients as possible.

breweries.name: Pipeworks Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Pipeworks began, as many breweries do, in the stove top kettles and plastic-bucket fermenters of the home brewer. Beejay Oslon and Gerrit Lewis met while working at Chicago's famous West Lakeview Liquors, a haven for beer geeks in search of new and exciting brews from around the world. While working there, the two got to thinking it was time to turn their passion in to a business.

 The first steps in that long journey  took them to a the small town of Lo in the Belgian countryside. It was there that the Pipeworks boys lived and worked with Urbain Coutteau owner and brewer at the De Struise Brewery. While working there the boys honed their craft, learned the ins and outs of running a brewery, and had the opportunity to create their first commercially available beers. The success of these brews fueled their passion and prepared them for the work ahead of them.

 Upon coming back to the States the two began experimenting with pilot batches, formulating a business plan, and developing an image for Pipeworks.

 Now we are ready to bring what we've learned to the craft beer world!

breweries.name: The Mash House Brewery & Chophouse
breweries.description: We use no preservatives and only the finest ingredients at our on-site microbrewery: malted barley, hops, yeast and pure water. Our beer begins in our grain silo out front, is converted into "mash" with the addition of water, then ferments and ages in our custom-designed brewhouse—assuring our customers will receive the freshest pint possible. And there are seven ways to try our award-winning brews: by the pint (16 oz.), by the half yard (25 oz.), by the pitcher (64 oz.), by the hopper (116 oz. mini-keg), by the Mini Mash (any four beers on tap), by the Mondo Mash (4 oz. glasses of each of our 9 drafts), or by the Growler (take it to go!)

data.name: Natural Blonde Ale
data.description: Blonde ale is an American tradition. Using all malted barley and only fresh hops, this delicious golden Blonde ale is light and crisp with a delicate malt flavor and a dry hop finish. Try it with lemonade for a Shandy.

breweries.name: The People's Pint
breweries.description: Located at 24 Federal Street in Greenfield, The People's Pint has been open since January 1st, 1997. Since then, we've offered delicious food, quality ales & lagers, and friendly service. The Pint is open daily at 11 a.m. for lunch. The dinner menu is available from 4 - 10 p.m. and we have a late night menu from 10 p.m. - Midnight. We do not take reservations. All ages are welcome.

data.name: NazionAle
data.description: The first beer made from 100% Italian Italian totally raw materials, grown by us, so as to produce this beer intentionally simple, where water, malt, hops and yeast come together in a harmonious and original. A beer that will find admirers and that will push to combinations and combinations more or less daring but today is "primarily" a turning point in the production of Italian craft beer.

breweries.name: Birrificia Le Baladin
breweries.description: It is the place where it all started. There would be much to say and tell it to start back over the key dates. In 1986, Teo decides, with his partner then Michelle, a pretty young French dancer, to open in Piozzo, a small town unknown to the door of the Langhe where he was born, a "creperie"! He rents a former "tavern" with an attached mini apartment on the top floor and a gravel courtyard on the back and opens its doors. At first, his passion for beer, and a little 'light his aversion for wine led him to fill the menu with more than two hundred references international beers, as well as dainties to enjoy to work alongside the crepes. Gradually, the goodness of the choices made ​​good name and port customers to small local baptized "Le Baladin" by his friend François of CIRQUE BIDON in homage to the nature of Teo same. Years went by and the room expands, you change, you will see a big circus tent to cover the courtyard paved with gravel now tables and chairs in style "Oktoberfest" and hand in hand also changes his mentor: Nora is now its new companion and muse together and decide a new course of the local : transform the creperie in a brewpub! After months of study and travel with Nora to discover Belgian brewers have our hero returns with huge bins loaded onto a van Volkswagen Westfalia and places them in the garage of the ousted former owner of the house, adjacent to the restaurant, now transformed into a microbrewery. So begins the adventure productive BEER BALADIN that sees just two beers "taxes" to the regulars who frequent the pub goers somewhat perplexed and embarrassed to taste these first, honestly a bit 'adventurous productions Teo. Over time, the production will be moved to other places for sizing issues and logistics, but still the aura of magic that permeated the early days of the brewery remains unchanged. Today, large kitchen has taken the place of the production and in the pub beers are on tap now classic carnet baladiniano as well as all production in the bottle. Occasionally a few small tweaks gives customers reason of surprise and veiled "Amarcord" in which one of them remembers the beginnings of this place, now a destination for "pilgrimage" by many fans of the beer world. It is always a place where good food is accompanied not only by our beers but by good music and by the sympathy of the staff who always has a smile for everyone and where it is customary to a friendly "welcome", a hello and a good day to all those who pass through it if only for a small beer refreshing.

data.name: NE Blonde Ale
data.description:
This pale refreshing Ale is sure to delight with its delicate balance of pilsner malt and noble hops. 
The cool Ale fermentation gives our Blonde a slight fruitiness that heightens its already refreshing character.  Absolutely refreshing and every bit a Session Beer, the lighter aspects of this Ale give way to an interesting Hop finish that reminds us that while lighter in color, this should not be confused with a “Light Beer”.

data.name: Neptune's Nitro
data.description: Originally built as summer beach houses in 1894, the Neptune cottages (also known as Red Rest and Red Roost) remain to this day a reminder of adventure in the wild west. In a community that is known for it's picturesque contemporary architecture, this landmark stands as an outlaw along scenic Coast Boulevard. A renegade landmark deserves a renegade beer—ours is served on Nitro, baby!

data.name: Neurotic Blonde
data.description: The first batch off the new brewhouse will be our Neurotic Blonde Ale. Brew Wërks is proud to of the overwhelming reception this blonde ale has received in our pub and in other venues. It offers a light taste with a full rich flavor. Perfect for those who want to have a craft beer experience without the bite. You don’t have to be a neurotic blond to enjoy it, but you would be crazy if you simply did not try it.

breweries.name: Brew Wërks Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2011, our passion for great beer has driven us to carve out a niche wherever possible as we strive to bring our own sense of innovation to a very informed local beer consumer. We recognize that the bar has been set high, and we are excited by the opportunity to earn your admiration amongst so many great breweries.

We strive to make beers that push the boundaries of common conception, bursting with flavors and aromas that encourage brew fans to relish in the lush sensory experience. Unfiltered and unrefined, our lineup is designed to encourage the drinker to embrace change as our robust signature mouth feel stretches the palate beyond its previous expectation.

breweries.name: Sanctum Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The two founding members of this amazing endeavor began as homebrewers. They ate their barley, smelled their hops and eventually grew up to be big and strong! After winning a few awards and having accolades from just about every single person who ever drank their beer (they wish), they knew it was a calling and not just a hobby. 
​
Sanctum is the natural extension of the way Jason and Scott live their lives. Their value for community, giving back to those who need it and pursuing excellence in all their endeavors is reflected in Sanctum as a company. "Why can't we use beer to help the world?" has been a common thought throughout the building process. And that's why they have decided to consistently give a portion of proceeds to charity. Every pint. Every keg. Every brew . Now every Sanctum drinker can boldly proclaim they are the most generous beer drinkers in the world!
​
Sanctum exists to be a light in the dreary world. To look mediocrity in the eye and say "no sir, I don't like it!" To push the limits of what being a craft brewery means, and to look spiffy doing it!

breweries.name: Redhook Ale Brewery
breweries.description: In 1981, Gordon Bowker and Paul Shipman started Redhook Ale Brewery in an old transmission shop in Seattle. Early missteps led to a cult following and eventually led to widespread acclaim that inspired countless craft brewers. Still, more than 25 years later, no brewery has been able to achieve the pure, unqualified Liquid Goodness of Redhook.

breweries.name: Russian River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Russian River Brewing Company (RRBC) was originally owned by Korbel Champagne Cellars in Guerneville, California and was founded on their historic and beautiful property amidst vineyards and redwoods near the Russian River. When Korbel decided to get out of the beer business in 2003, they generously offered the brewmaster, Vinnie Cilurzo and his wife Natalie the rights to the brand. Russian River Brewing might be something completely different now if it weren't for this incredible opportunity.
On April 3, 2004, Vinnie and Natalie reopened RRBC as a brewpub in downtown Santa Rosa to great success and began self-distributing to nearby clients. In 2008, they opened a production brewery about 1 mile from their brewpub allowing them to triple production, take on more accounts locally, and distribute some beer in 4 more states.

breweries.name: Jester King Craft Brewery
breweries.description: Located in the beautiful Texas Hill Country, Jester King Craft Brewery is an authentic farmhouse brewery committed to brewing artisan ales of great depth and character. At times drawing influences from the world beyond traditional brewers’ yeast, Jester King’s beer is not rushed to market but allowed to mature – often in oak barrels – to create the most enjoyable, interesting and exciting beer we can make. An additional layer of complexity is added to Jester King’s bottled beers by allowing a second fermentation to take place in the bottle. As part of its commitment to sustainability, the slow food movement and Texas, Jester King beer uses as many organic and local ingredients as possible and will soon be brewed with harvested rainwater.

data.name: NorCal Blonde
data.description: NorCal Blonde is a light, straw-colored ale with a very crisp finish. It has a very subtle hop profile with very little bitterness and virtually no hop aroma. This is an ale that was brewed with the first time microbrew drinker in mind.

data.name: Nordic Blonde
data.description: Our lightest offering is clean and crisp with modest bitterness and aroma. Golden in color and balanced with a bit of sweetness from our imported English malts, this is a great beer for all to appreciate.

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: Golden or Blonde Ale
style.description: Golden or Blonde ales are straw to golden blonde in color. They have a crisp, dry palate, light to medium body, and light malt sweetness. Low to medium hop aroma may be present but does not dominate. Bitterness is low to medium. Fruity esters may be perceived but do not predominate. Diacetyl should not be perceived. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Lone Peak Brewery
breweries.description: Lone Peak Brewery is located in the Meadow Village Center, next to the Big Sky Post Office and Country Market. The "Brewski" building not only home to the First and only microbrewery in Big Sky, but home to the Gallatin River Gallery, a quaint gallery of local artists. Follow the highway signs from Highway 191 to Highway 64 and stop on by for a sample or pint of the best brew around. I kid you not!
